00034 // This file contains the interface definition for the class Connections,
00035 // which manages a set of Connect objects. Once created, a Connect * can be
00036 // added (managed) and refferred to by an integer. The int can also be used
00037 // to delete the Connect *.
00038 //
00039 // This class should become a mapping between (Connect *)s and some other
00040 // type -- the type normally used by an API to refer to one of its
00041 // objects/files. For netcdf and JGOFS, int will do just fine, but other APIs
00042 // (HDF ?) use pointers. 
00043 //
00044 // jhrg 9/30/94
00045 
00046 #ifndef _connections_h
00047 #define _connections_h
00048 
00049 #ifdef __GNUG__
00050 #pragma interface
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 #include <vector>
00054 
00055 #ifndef _connect_h
00056 #include "Connect.h"
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 using std::vector;
00060 
00061 const int MAX_CONNECTIONS = 64;
00062 
00072 template <class T>
00073 class Connections {
00074 private:
00075     int _max_con;
00076     vector<int> _free;      // free list of connections
00077     T *_conns;          // array alloc'd at object construction
00078 
00079     void init_array(int i);
00080 
00081 public:
00082     Connections(int max_connections = MAX_CONNECTIONS);
00083 
00084     Connections(const Connections<T> &cs);
00085     virtual ~Connections();
00086 
00087     Connections &operator=(const Connections<T> &rhs);
00088 
00089     T &operator[](int i);
00090 
00091     int add_connect(T c);
00092 
00093     void del_connect(int i);
00094 };
00095
